page.title:
AWIPS A Brief History
AWIPS
A Brief History
page.enlisting:
• The original prime contract for system development was awarded to PRC, Inc on December 29, 1992 – To replace Automation of Field Operations and Services (AFOS) – PRC, Inc later acquired by Northrop Grumman IT (NGIT) – Commissioned - 2000 • Operations phase of original contract expired on • Re-compete contract awarded to Raytheon Technical Services (RTS) on August 17, 2005 – Proposal included a high level plan to re-engineer AWIPS • The original prime contract for system development was
• The original prime contract for system development was

page.title:
AWIPS II Technology Infusion Scope
AWIPS II Technology Infusion Scope
page.normal_text:
AWIPS II Technology Infusion (FY2005 – FY2015)
AWIPS II Technology Infusion (FY2005 – FY2015)
page.enlisting:
– A long-term project which delivers a modern, robust software infrastructure that • Phase 1: (FY2006-FY2011) – Migration of WFO/RFC AWIPS (AWIPS I) to a modern Service Oriented Architecture • Phase II: (FY2009-FY2012) – AWIPS SOA Extension – Creation of a seamless weather enterprise spanning NWS operations • Phase III: (FY2009 – FY2015) – Enterprise Level Enhancements – A long-term project which delivers a modern, robust software infrastructure that
– A long-term project which delivers a modern, robust software infrastructure that
• Phase 1: (FY2006-FY2011)
• Phase 1: (FY2006-FY2011)
– Migration of WFO/RFC AWIPS (AWIPS I) to a modern Service Oriented Architecture
– Migration of WFO/RFC AWIPS (AWIPS I) to a modern Service Oriented Architecture
• Phase II: (FY2009-FY2012) – AWIPS SOA Extension
• Phase II: (FY2009-FY2012) – AWIPS SOA Extension
– Creation of a seamless weather enterprise spanning NWS operations
– Creation of a seamless weather enterprise spanning NWS operations
• Phase III: (FY2009 – FY2015) – Enterprise Level Enhancements
• Phase III: (FY2009 – FY2015) – Enterprise Level Enhancements
provides the foundation for future system level enhancements for the entire NWS enterprise

enterprise
(SOA) infrastructure executed incrementally through a series of task orders

page.title:
AWIPS I to AWIPS II Re-Architecture Approach
AWIPS I to AWIPS II
Re-Architecture Approach
page.enlisting:
• Perform “black-box” conversion – Preserve existing functionality, look and feel on top of new • Thorough field validation and acceptance before deployment – Incremental releases via task orders for test and evaluation • No loss of functionality – Deployed system current with deployed AWIPS capability (i.e., • Use open source projects - No proprietary code – JAVA and open source projects enable AWIPS II to be platform • Objective is to make AWIPS II available for collaborative • Perform “black-box” conversion
• Perform “black-box” conversion • P e r f o r m

page.title:
AWIPS II Primary Standards & Formats
AWIPS II Primary Standards & Formats
page.enlisting:
Ingested Data Formats – GRIB1/GRIB2 – Gridded data – NetCDF3 – Support AWIPSI/II interoperability – BUFR – Observational Data, e.g., soundings – METAR, SHEF – Surface and hydrological data – GINI – Satellite Imagery – OPRG L3 – Radar Imagery – Text Messages – Text products • Data Store Formats – PostGres – Metadata and select data type store, e.g., text – HDF5 – Binary store for grids, imagery and select observations • Product Distribution – NetCDF3 – NDFD Grids – ASCII Text – Text products Ingested Data Formats – GRIB1/GRIB2 – Gridded data – NetCDF3 – Support AWIPSI/II interoperability – BUFR – Observational Data, e.g., soundings – METAR, SHEF – Surface and hydrological data – GINI – Satellite Imagery – OPRG L3 – Radar Imagery – Text Messages – Text products
Ingested Data Formats
– GRIB1/GRIB2 – Gridded data
– NetCDF3 – Support AWIPSI/II interoperability
– BUFR – Observational Data, e.g., soundings
– METAR, SHEF – Surface and hydrological data
– GINI – Satellite Imagery
– OPRG L3 – Radar Imagery
– Text Messages – Text products
• Data Store Formats
• Data Store Formats
– PostGres – Metadata and select data type store, e.g., text – HDF5 – Binary store for grids, imagery and select observations
– PostGres – Metadata and select data type store, e.g., text
– HDF5 – Binary store for grids, imagery and select observations
• Product Distribution
• Product Distribution
– NetCDF3 – NDFD Grids – ASCII Text – Text products
– NetCDF3 – NDFD Grids
– ASCII Text – Text products

National Centers Perspective
